alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 9:27PM PST until December 31 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 5500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches. * WHERE...Modoc County, mostly the higher terrain, including the Warner Mountains and a portion of Highway 299 at Cedar Pass. This also includes Willow Ranch and a portion of Highway 395. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 4 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a 40% chance that snowfall rates approach 1"/hr between 6 AM and 8 AM PST. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
